page.title: 15LOCAL AND NATIONAL ISSUES
page.content: Over 55% of people regard unemployment as the greatest problem facing our nation in the 1980s. The next most important subject was violent crime, many believe this to be due to a lack of dicipline. Nuclear war was thought to be the greatest problem by only 5% of the people. At the top of the list of local problems was the lack of street lighting in the villages. Many wish to have better facilities for the young and elderly, whilst a similar number want to see the woodland and hedgerows managed better and not destroyed. Improved roads and a ban on aerial crop-spraying were also mentioned by several people.
